MANAGE.USERS_AND_REGISTRATIONS_I: Manage the users and everything related to the event registrations.
MANAGE.EMAIL_TEMPLATES_I: Set the templates for the following notification emails.

EMAIL_TEMPLATES_TYPES.SPOT_ASSIGNED: A spot has been assigned to a user
EMAIL_TEMPLATES_TYPES.REGISTRATION_CONFIRMED: A user's spot has been paid and confirmed
EMAIL_TEMPLATES_TYPES.SPOT_TRANSFERRED: A user's spot has been transferred to another user
EMAIL_TEMPLATES_TYPES.SPOT_RELEASED: A user has been released from his spot

MANAGE.DOCUMENT_TEMPLATES_I: Set the templates for the following documents.

DOCUMENT_TEMPLATES_TYPES.INVOICE: The invoice for user spot payment

MANAGE.SESSIONS_MANAGEMENT_I: Set the minimum number of sessions per day and the maximum number of total sessions for each user
MANAGE.MIN_SESSION_DAY_LIMIT: Minimum number of sessions per day
MANAGE.CONTENTS_I: Create and organise the contents of the event.
MANAGE.REGISTRATIONS_OPTIONS_I: Open/close the registrations and other options.
MANAGE.SESSION_BUFFER: Time interval between sessions for registration.
MANAGE.ALLOW_COUNTRY_LEADER_ASSIGN_SPOT: Allow country leaders to assign spots
MANAGE.REGISTRATION_FORM_I: Add, manage and remove the fields requested during the registration.
MANAGE.EVENT_SPOTS_I: Decide the spot types available for this event.
MANAGE.EVENT_SPOTS_II: It is adviced NOT to change the spot types in any way during the registrations.

EMAIL_TEMPLATE.SUBJECT: Subject
EMAIL_TEMPLATE.BAD_TEMPLATE: The template seems to have some problems. Please check its correctness.

VARIABLES.COUNTRY: The country of the user target of the notification
VARIABLES.SECTION: The section of the user target of the notification
VARIABLES.SPOT_TYPE: The spot type of the user target of the notification
VARIABLES.SPOT_ID: The spot ID (reference) of the user target of the notification
VARIABLES.PRICE: The price of the spot for the user target of the notification

PRIVACY_POLICY.DISCLAIMER: Erasmus Student Network (ESN) is an independent, non-partisan, non-political, and non-profit, international association which operates under Belgian law. ESN is supported as a Civil Society stakeholder by both the Council of Europe, through the European Youth Foundation and European Union, through the Civil Society Cooperation Grant, co-funded by the European Union. Disclaimer for the Co-funding of the European Union: Views and opinions expressed are however those of the author(s) only and do not necessarily reflect those of the European Union or the European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA). Neither the European Union nor EACEA can be held responsible for them.
PRIVACY_POLICY.INTRODUCTION:
1. Introduction
  1.1 We are committed to safeguarding the privacy of our website visitors and Erasmus Generation Meeting participants; in this policy we explain how we will treat your personal information.
  1.2 By using our website and agreeing to this policy, you consent to our use of cookies in accordance with the terms of this policy.
  1.3 By using our website and agreeing to this policy, you also agree to the Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy of those third parties involved in payment processing.
PRIVACY_POLICY.PRIVATE_DATA:
2. Collecting personal information
  2.1 We may collect, store and use the following kinds of personal information:
   (a) information about your computer and about your visits to and use of this website (including your IP address, geographical location, browser type and version, operating system, referral source, length of visit, page views, and website navigation paths);
   (b) Information that you provide when registering to our website, including information gathered in case of log in using ESN Accounts.
   (c) information that you provide when registering for the Erasmus Generation Meeting through our website, which may include, but is not limited to: your name, email address, nationality, gender, ESN membership number (if applicable)and any other information necessary for event registration and participation.
   (d) information relating to any payments you make for event registration (including transaction identifiers and payment status);
   (e) any other personal information that you choose to send to us.

2.2 Before you disclose to us the personal information of another person, you must obtain that person's consent to both the disclosure and the processing of that personal information in accordance with this policy.
PRIVACY_POLICY.USE_PRIVATE_DATA:
3. Using personal information
  3.1 Personal information submitted to us through our website will be used for the purposes specified in this policy or on the relevant pages of the website.
  3.2 We may use your personal information to administer our website, personalize our website for you, enable your use of the services available on our website, process payments for event registration, send you non-marketing communications about the Erasmus Generation Meeting, send you email notifications that you have specifically requested, deal with enquiries and complaints made by or about you relating to our website and the event, keep our website secure and prevent fraud, verify compliance with the terms and conditions governing the use of our website and event participation.
  3.3 If you submit personal information for publication on our website, we will publish and otherwise use that information in accordance with the licence you grant to us.
  3.4 We will not, without your express consent, supply your personal information to any third party for the purpose of their or any other third party's direct marketing.
4. Disclosing personal information
  4.1 We may disclose your personal information to any of our employees, officers, insurers, professional advisers, agents, suppliers or subcontractors insofar as reasonably necessary for the purposes set out in this policy.
  4.2 We may disclose your personal information to any member of our organization and supporting organisms (this means: our Committees, Project Teams, National Boards, Sections and any other pre-existing or ulteriorly created internal body) insofar as reasonably necessary for the purposes set out in this policy and to guarantee the deliverables of the service offered.
  4.3 We may disclose your personal information: to the extent that we are required to do so by law, in connection with any ongoing or prospective legal proceedings, in order to establish, exercise or defend our legal rights (including providing information to others for the purposes of fraud prevention), to any person who we reasonably believe may apply to a court or other competent authority for disclosure of that personal information where, in our reasonable opinion, such court or authority would be reasonably likely to order disclosure of that personal information and to the University and/or Erasmus Generation Meeting organizers, but only to the extent necessary for managing the event.
  4.4 Except as provided in this policy, we will not provide your personal information to third parties.
PRIVACY_POLICY.INTERNATIONAL_TRANSFER:
5. International data transfers
  5.1 Information that we collect may be stored and processed in and transferred between any of the countries in which we or our associate members operate in order to enable us to use the information in accordance with this policy.
  5.2 Information that we collect may be transferred to countries which do not have data protection laws equivalent to those in force in the European Economic Area. ESN International cannot guarantee the safety of your data in regards to such transfer.
  5.3 You expressly agree to the transfers of personal information described in this Section 5.
PRIVACY_POLICY.RETAINING_DATA:
6. Retaining personal information
  6.1 This Section 6 sets out our data retention policies and procedure, which are designed to help ensure that we comply with our legal obligations in relation to the retention and deletion of personal information.
  6.2 Personal information that we process for any purpose or purposes shall not be kept for longer than is necessary for that purpose or those purposes.
  6.3 Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Section 6, we will retain documents (including electronic documents) containing personal data: to the extent that we are required to do so by law, if we believe that the documents may be relevant to any ongoing or prospective legal proceedings and in order to establish, exercise or defend our legal rights (including providing information to others for the purposes of fraud prevention and reducing credit risk).
  6.4 We will retain personal information related to the Erasmus Generation Meeting for 6 months after the conclusion of the event, after which it will be securely deleted unless you request otherwise or we are required to keep it for legal reasons.
PRIVACY_POLICY.SECURITY_DATA:
7. Security of personal information
  7.1 We will take reasonable technical and organisational precautions to prevent the loss, misuse or alteration of your personal information.
  7.2 We will store all the personal information you provide on our secure (password- and firewall-protected) servers.
  7.3 All electronic financial transactions entered into through our website will be protected by encryption technology.
  7.4 You acknowledge that the transmission of information over the internet is inherently insecure, and we cannot guarantee the security of data sent over the internet, nor within the intranet.
  7.5 You refuse to held ESN International responsible for the improper or illegal use of your accessible information as set in clauses 3.2, 3.3 and 3.7 of this Privacy Policy. It's the user's obligation to consider the risks upon submission, management and publication of the user's personal information on our platform.
  7.6 You are ultimately responsible for keeping the password you use for accessing our website confidential; we will never ask you for your password (except when you log in to our website - moment in which it is encrypted).
PRIVACY_POLICY.AMENDEMENT:
8. Amendments
  8.1 We may update this policy from time to time by publishing a new version on our website.
  8.2 You should check this page occasionally to ensure you are happy with any changes to this policy.
  8.3 We may notify you of changes to this policy by email or through a notification system on our website.
PRIVACY_POLICY.RIGHTS:
9. Your rights
  9.1 You may instruct us to provide you with any personal information we hold about you by writing to wpa@esn.org; provision of such information will be subject to: the payment of a fee (currently fixed at â‚¬10), and the supply of appropriate evidence of your identity. For this purpose, we will usually accept a photocopy of your passport certified by a solicitor or bank plus an original copy of a utility bill showing your current address.
  9.2 We may withhold personal information that you request to the extent permitted by law.
  9.3 You may instruct us at any time not to process your personal information for marketing purposes.
  9.4 In practice, you will usually either expressly agree in advance to our use of your personal information for marketing purposes.
  9.5 You have the right to remove your ESN Galaxy account and all the information which is stored with it at any given time. You can do so by selecting 'Delete' on your profile page.
  9.6 When your account is deleted, all the personal information and other data linked to it is also deleted.
PRIVACY_POLICY.THIRD_PART_AND_COOKIES:
10. Third party websites
  10.1 Our website includes hyperlinks to, and details of, third party websites.
  10.2 We have no control over, and are not responsible for, the privacy policies and practices of third parties.
11. Updating information
  11.1 Please let us know if the personal information that we hold about you needs to be corrected or updated.
  12. Cookies
  12.1 Our website uses cookies.
  12.2 A cookie is a file containing an identifier (a string of letters and numbers) that is sent by a web server to a web browser and is stored by the browser. The identifier is then sent back to the server each time the browser requests a page from the server.
  12.3 Cookies may be either 'persistent' cookies or 'session' cookies: a persistent cookie will be stored by a web browser and will remain valid until its set expiry date, unless deleted by the user before the expiry date; a session cookie, on the other hand, will expire at the end of the user session, when the web browser is closed.
  12.4 Cookies do not typically contain any information that personally identifies a user, but personal information that we store about you may be linked to the information stored in and obtained from cookies.
  12.5 We use both session and persistent cookies on our website.
  12.6 Most browsers allow you to refuse to accept cookies.
  12.7 Blocking all cookies will have a negative impact upon the usability of many websites.
  12.8 If you block cookies, you will not be able to use all the features on our website.
PRIVACY_POLICY.ACCEPT_PRIVACY:
13. Erasmus Generation Meeting Specific Provisions
  13.1 By registering for the Erasmus Generation Meeting through our website, you consent to the collection and processing of your personal data as described in this policy, specifically for the purposes related to organizing and conducting the event.
  13.2 Your data collected for the Erasmus Generation Meeting will be used solely for the purposes of event management and communication. We will not use this data for unrelated marketing purposes.
  13.3 You have the right to request access to, correction of, or deletion of your event-related personal data at any time by contacting wpa@esn.org.
  13.4 After the conclusion of the Erasmus Generation Meeting, we will retain your data for the period specified in section 6.4 of this policy, after which it will be securely deleted unless you request otherwise or we are required to keep it for legal reasons.

TERMS.INTRO:
These Terms and Conditions of Use (hereafter TCU) govern your access to and use of the app.erasmusgeneration.org website and services, which are provided by Erasmus Student Network AISBL (hereafter ESN). Please read these TCU carefully, and contact us if you have any questions.
ESN reserves the right to modify or replace any of these TCU, or change, suspend, or discontinue the Service (including without limitation, the availability of any feature or content) at any time by posting a notice on the site.
If you continue to browse and use app.erasmusgeneration.org, you signify that you have read, understand and agree to be bound by these TCU. Therefore, any participation in this website will constitute full and irrevocable acceptance of the TCU. If you do not agree to abide by the above, please do not use this site.
The terms us or we or our refer to the owner of the website, ESN AISBL. The terms you or your refer to the User of the website.
1. Definitions: Associates shall mean any natural person or legal entity that co-operate with ESN for the purposes of the Erasmus Generation Meeting, Cookie shall mean a file saved on the User's computer, which records necessary information for the best function of the website. This file is sent by the Server to the browser used by the user at the time and is saved in their computer. Cookies have a predefined duration. User shall refer to individuals who are registering for or participating in the Erasmus Generation Meeting. Website, EGM platform, site, media, platform, project shall refer to the webpage app.erasmusgeneration.org which is hosted, powered and maintained by ESN.
2. Registered Owner
The Erasmus Generation Meeting platform is owned and maintained by Erasmus Student Network AISBL, registered office address: Rue Joseph II / Jozef II-straat 120, 1000 Brussels, Belgium. Erasmus Student Network (ESN) is a non-profit international student organisation. Our mission is to represent international students, thus provide opportunities for cultural understanding and self-development under the principle of Students Helping Students.
TERMS.SERVICE:
3. Platform - Description of services
The Erasmus Generation Meeting platform is designed to facilitate registration and participation in the Erasmus Generation Meeting event.
4. Registration - Access to the website
You can register using your ESN Accounts credentials or by creating a new account using your email address and a password.
You warrant that you provide accurate and truthful registration information. You have to keep your registration information accurate and up-to-date. You shall not provide any false personal information to the EGM platform (including a false e-mail) or create any account for anyone other than yourself without such person's permission, use another person's information with the intent to impersonate that person or use an EGM platform account that is subject to any rights of a person other than you without appropriate authorization.
By registering to the EGM platform, you agree that you are at least 18 years old at the moment of registration.
TERMS.RIGHTS:
5. Owner rights and obligations
ESN will take all due care and diligence and use best efforts to ensure that the material hosted and published on the Platform will be available with no interruptions. ESN will take all due care in order to ensure that the website is in line with all terms and conditions hereby listed. ESN may at its sole discretion deny the provision of services to the Users, in cases where the information does not comply with the terms and conditions, or when the content is unlawful, disrespectful, discriminating and/or against the principles of ESN and exchange programmes.
6. User rights and obligations
Users must provide ESN with all the information that is needed for registration and participation in the Erasmus Generation Meeting. Users are solely responsible for the accuracy of the information they provide.
Users shall not charge or require other users on the platform or outside of it a direct or indirect financial or other type of fee in order to partake in the Erasmus Generation Meeting. ESN has the right to remove any content that breaches this requirement, as well as reject future access to the EGM platform to any User that does not comply with this requirement.
TERMS.LIABILITY:
7. Liability Policy - Limitation of Liability
This site and its content are offered for informational purposes only; ESN shall not be responsible or liable for the accuracy, usefulness or availability of any information made available via the site, and shall not be responsible or liable for any error or omissions in that information.
We will not be responsible, or liable to any third party, for the content or accuracy of any materials posted by you or any other user of the website. You are solely responsible for the content you upload. We have the right to remove any material or posting you make on the Website if, in our opinion, such material does not comply with the content standards set out in our acceptable use policy.
In no event will ESN be responsible in contract, tort, negligence or otherwise for loss of profits, business, contracts, revenues, goodwill, production and anticipating savings or any indirect, consequential, special or economic loss of any kind arising from any failure to publish or host in a timely manner or at all any content or from any faults, omissions, technical problems and malfunctioning attributed to the Platform, Internet Service Providers or delays in the transmission or storage.
8. Data Privacy Protection
You can consult all the terms concerning the privacy of your information in our full Privacy Policy.
9. Intellectual property rights
All EGM platform content (images, pictures and logos) is protected by copyright. Copying of our logos and/or any other third party logos, and content accessed via this website and publishing it elsewhere is not permitted without prior written approval from ESN or the relevant copyright owner. We also do not permit use of our logo as a link without prior permission.
Requests for permission to use our logo should be directed to communication@esn.org .
TERMS.LAW_AND_MISCELLANEOUS:
10. Miscellaneous
Change of terms and conditions: ESN reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to modify or replace any of these TCU, it is your responsibility to check these TCU periodically for changes. Your continued use of the EGM platform following the posting of any changes to these TCU constitutes acceptance of those changes.
11. Applicable Law and jurisdiction
You agree that in the event of any dispute of any nature that may arise between you and the EGM platform, these terms and conditions of use shall be governed by and construed exclusively in accordance with the law of Belgium. Each party hereby irrevocably submits to the jurisdiction of the Courts of Brussels.
These Terms and Conditions of Use were last revised on 8th October 2024

IMPORT.TITLE: Import
IMPORT.SELECT_ENTITY_TO_IMPORT_I: Note: child entities must be imported after their parents.

SEL_ENTITIES_DISCLAIMERS.ROOMS: Rooms should be imported after the venues. Rooms of non existing venues will be ignored.
SEL_ENTITIES_DISCLAIMERS.SPEAKERS: Speakers should be imported after the organisations. Speakers of non existing organisations will be ignored.
SEL_ENTITIES_DISCLAIMERS.SESSIONS: Sessions should be imported after rooms and speakers. Sessions without an existing room or with non existing speakers will be ignored.

IMPORT.PREPARE_DATA_DOWNLOAD_TEMPLATE: 2. Prepare your data on an Excel spreadsheet
IMPORT.PREPARE_DATA_DOWNLOAD_TEMPLATE_I: Gather the data for this entity and prepare it on an Excel spreadsheet (.xls, .xlsx).
IMPORT.PREPARE_DATA_DOWNLOAD_TEMPLATE_II: We suggest you use our template, to speed up the rest of the import process.
IMPORT.PREPARE_DATA_DOWNLOAD_TEMPLATE_III: The template contains some sample elements between the ones currently avaiable on this team; you can safely delete those elements from the template before you insert your data.
IMPORT.UPLOAD_DATA: 3. Upload the Excel spreadsheet containing the elements
IMPORT.UPLOAD_DATA_I: Pick the file (.xls, .xlsx) you filled in with your elements for the selected entity.
IMPORT.UPLOAD_DATA_II: Note: the first row will be used as header, to identify the name of the columns.
IMPORT.METADATA_CONFIGURATION_I: Read carefully all the notes and configure the last options.
IMPORT.ENTITY_IS_CONFIGURED_WITH_AUTOMATIC_IDS:
The entity is configured to manage the ID (identifiers) automatically.
This means you won't be able to choose the identifiers: Scarlett will create them for you.
You can change this behaviour in the Team page.
IMPORT.ENTITY_IS_CONFIGURED_WITH_MANUAL_IDS:
The entity is configured to require manual ID (identifiers).
You can change this behaviour in the Team page.
IMPORT.METADATA_CONFIGURATION_COLS_I: Associate each expected attribute for the entity with a column read from the Excel file.
IMPORT.METADATA_CONFIGURATION_COLS_II: The attributes for which a value is obligatory are higlighted with an asterisk.
IMPORT.PREVIEW_IMPORT_I: Decide if you want to skip some elements or whether to perform a full import.
IMPORT.PREVIEW_IMPORT_II: Invalid elements (e.g. attributes are missing) won't be imported.
IMPORT.PREVIEW_IMPORT_III: Existing elements are skipped by default, but you can include them back to overwrite their values.
IMPORT.ELEMENT_EXISTS_WILL_BE_OVERWRITTEN: The element exists already; if selected, it will be overwritten.
IMPORT.INTERRUPT_HINT: Interrupt the import flow and avoid new insertions
IMPORT.INVALID_ELEMENT_WONT_BE_IMPORTED: The element is invalid and it won't be imported.
IMPORT.RESULTS_I: Monitor the import results as it goes (it may take a few minutes).
